meanings.definition: A close-fitting undergarment, often reinforced with stays, worn to shape and support the body.
meanings.sent1: She wore a corset under her dress to give her waist a defined shape.
meanings.sent2: The historical drama featured actresses in elaborate corsets to depict the fashion of the time.
meanings.sent3: The corset was so tight, she joked that she could barely breathe after a big meal.
meanings.sent4: Her strict diet and exercise regimen acted as a corset, molding her figure over time.
meanings.sent5: The corset hugged her torso like a second skin, enhancing her posture.

meanings.definition: To enclose in or as if in a corset.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers corseted the fragile pipes to protect them from damage.
meanings.sent2: She corsets her emotions tightly, rarely showing her true feelings to others.
meanings.sent3: The magician corseted the rabbit in a tiny box, only to reveal it unharmed moments later.
meanings.sent4: His fear corseted his actions, limiting his ability to take risks.
meanings.sent5: The vines corseted the old house, giving it a mysterious and overgrown appearance.
